name: American Spikenard
edibleDescription: The fleshy berries that measure about 6 mm in size are edible; however, each fruit contains several light brown small seeds. The fruit has a very pleasant taste and can be used to make juice, fruit leather, jellies, etc. The berries typically do not ripen until September depending on geographical location. The root is aromatic and has a spicy taste. The tips of young shoots of this herb are cooked and also used as a potherb or in the form of flavouring in soups.
